title: Torque and work - compare work on rod

content.question: In Figures <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, a rod is initially rotating counterclockwise with angular speed <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> about an axis at the center of the rod when two tangential forces of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> are exerted on the ends of the rod in the directions indicated in the figures. Friction forces are negligible. The forces are exerted over the same angular displacement <math alttext="delta theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>θ</mi></math> of the rod.
